body.p:
Franklin Ky
May 7th 1863
To his Excellency
Govenor James. F. Robertson

The undersigned Citizens of Simpson County Ky would respectfully represent that at the Term 1861 of the Simpson Equity & Criminal Court, Catharine Hogan was indicted for the offence of "Keeping a Tipling House," and House of ill Fame." and her Mother Eleanor Dick became her Bail in the sum of Three Hundred & fifty Dollars and subsequently on account of the failure of Deft to appear, a forfeiture of said Bonds, was Taken, and the Mother of said Deft is now liable to pay the whole sum, Executions have been issued against the old Lady and are now Levied on a small tract of Land. her little Home and the only property She has, She is a very aged woman, decrepit, & partially Blind, and when this Little pittance is swept from her, She will be left at the mercy of the world; we hope you will interpose the Authority vested in you and remit such portion of the fine as may go to the Commonwealth. We feel sure that she is a fit object of Executive Clemency.

G, W, Hoy Sheriff
Geo W Millikin clk Simpson Cty Court
Wm M. Beson, Clerk Simpson Circuit Court
Wm Kidd Judge S C C
Wm W Bush Co atty

Simpson Eq. Ct
$350 } Forfeiture
Remitted 9th May 1863
J F Robinson
Elenor Dick
Issd May 14th 1863
